note.p: Death: His house in Manchester, Lancashire (27 June 1892)
Research Field: Organic chemistry, history of chemistry

Career: Apothecary's pupil, Gross-Armstadt; Pharmaceutical Assistant, Heidelberg; gave up business and entered the University of Giessen (1859); Assistant to H E Roscoe (FRS 1863), Owen's College, Manchester (1859); Senior Assistant in Owens College Laboratory, Manchester; Professor of Organic Chemistry, Manchester (1874); naturalised British (1879); died of a lingering disease
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1892-1893 vol 52 pp vii-ix signed by H E R
